script.title: Update Project Gap Analysis Panel
script.description: Updates the Project Gap Analysis panel in PersonalDashboard.html to replace the unordered list with a responsive table. The table includes columns: Project, Gap Category (Skill, Task, Resource, Dependency, Critical), Description, Dependencies, More Information, User Can Address?, and Action. Incorporates user skill evaluation (e.g., Adrian as UI/UX Designer) and uses Tailwind CSS for styling, matching the Social Web Dev template.

transformations.replace:
Project Gap Category Description Dependencies More Information User Can Address? Action
PRO-003 Skill Need 2 Senior React Developers Frontend development blocked; requires React expertise for UI components View Skills Required No (User skill: UI/UX, not React Dev) Find Contributor
PRO-003 Skill Need 1 Data Analyst Data processing module delayed; analytics integration pending View Analytics Specs No (User skill: UI/UX, not Data Analysis) Find Contributor
PRO-001 Task 3 Overdue Tasks (UI Design Incomplete) Blocks app deployment; affects 5 dependent features Task Details Yes (User skill: UI/UX Designer) Address Gap
PRO-004 Dependency 2 Pending Reviews Blocks code merge; delays chat module by 2 weeks Review Guidelines No (Requires Developer review) Request Review
PRO-005 Resource Lack of Design Tool Access Blocks wireframing; affects planning for 3 features Tool Requirements Yes (User can request access) Resolve Resource
PRO-002 Critical Security Audit Required High urgency; blocks all deployment dependencies Audit Checklist No (Requires Specialist) Prioritize Now
transformations.description: Replace the unordered list in the Project Gap Analysis panel with a responsive table. The table includes columns for Project, Gap Category (Skill, Task, Resource, Dependency, Critical), Description, Dependencies, More Information, User Can Address?, and Action. Uses Tailwind CSS classes to match the Social Web Dev template. Assumes user (Adrian) is a UI/UX Designer for 'User Can Address?' evaluation.

notes: The table uses Tailwind classes (min-w-full, divide-y, px-4 py-2) for responsiveness and styling consistency with the Social Web Dev template.
Gap categories include Skill (missing expertise), Task (incomplete tasks), Resource (unavailable tools), Dependency (blocked by other tasks), and Critical (high-urgency blockers).
The 'User Can Address?' column is based on sample data assuming Adrianâ€™s skill is UI/UX Designer. In a real implementation, this would query user profile data dynamically.
Action buttons use bg-primary for standard actions and bg-danger for Critical gaps to highlight urgency.
Sample data is derived from existing projects (e.g., PRO-001, PRO-002) and hypothetical gaps. Update with real project data as needed.
The transformation preserves the existing panel structure (card, header, time filter) and only replaces the list with the table.
